Neurology
South London Healthcare NHS Trust replies:
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

entry.content: Thank you for your comment. We are delighted at your positive experience at the trust, and your father's improvement. The Hyper Acute Stroke Unit (HASU) has only just opened and we are very proud of the service it provides to patients, which, as you have experienced, can be life-saving and have a significant impact on outcomes for stroke patients.

entry.content: Thank you for your comment. I'm sorry you couldn't find the information you were looking for on our website. We know that some of the information on the website needs updating, and we are working on this. If you have any other comments on the website, or would like to get involved in reviewing the pages, you can contact us at slh.communications@nhs.net I will also pass on your comment about the telephone to the manager of that service.

entry.title: I was very pleased with the service and treatment I received.

link.title: Organisation commented on
I was very pleased with the service and treatment I received.
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div:
Both before and after what could have been a very frightening and unpleasant experience I felt that I was receiving the best possible care and being kept informed at all times.
I felt that I was able to ask questions and be treated in a considerate and professional manner.
I was also impressed at how promptly I was seen to, and how everything happened very speedily and efficiently.

entry.title: Good service mostly but a few things could be improved.

link.title: Organisation commented on
Ear, Nose & Throat
Good service mostly but a few things could be improved.
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I liked the fact that I was seen on time and most of my issues were sorted out.

I have been having issues with my Tonsils and Adenoids for the past 9 months which have been affecting me on a daily basis and affecting my quality of life.
I felt I never had enough time to go into details about everything I was experiencing, I felt like I was being rushed and pushed out of the door, I have been having a lot of symptoms due to both the Tonsils and the Adenoids.
A Tonsillectomy was agreed but as I wasn't able to go into details regarding my symptoms that are being caused by my Adenoids my Adenoids are not being removed and obviously once I have my Tonsils removed I will still have problems in the future which would mean me having to get referred again by my GP to see another ENT Consultant which would probably mean that I would have to have another operation in future to have my Adenoids removed, This would defeat the object and waste valuable time and money as I know Adenoids can be removed at the same time the Tonsils are removed.

entry.title: Simply the Best hospital care I have experienced ever. Thank you F7

link.title: Organisation commented on
Simply the Best hospital care I have experienced ever. Thank you F7
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I would like like to Thank all the Staff on ward F7 for treating me and aiding my fast recovery. All the staff on this ward worked to a very high standard and worked as a team all of the time and made the patients feel better with there constant Good cheer. The staff where extremely busy but always made time for individual patients needs and al;ways answered my questions and set my mind at ease. I spent 12 Days with the staff of F7 Ward and can say the staff from Cleaning up to Doctor made my stay very welcoming at every point and I am very Humbled by them. Thank you very much for your expert care
Akll the staff on ward F7 deserve a medal for my care

entry.title: Poor

link.title: Organisation commented on
Accident and emergency services
Poor
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: Staff were friendly

I went in with back pain.AFter waiting 4hours I was x rayed.The nurse asked me to take my bra off for the x ray,which involved me sitting up and contorting my body,and therefore my spine.The result showed I had fractured my spine in two places. I thought this was appalingly incompetent and reckless.
I waited in the corridor on a stretcher for my x ray.THe nurses were talking amongst themselves about how dirty the hospital was and that it was an "infectious area".
I arrived at 2pm.they thought I may have ruputured my spleen or have internal bleeding.they requested a surgeon at 7pm and I did not see a doctor until 1am.10 hours after they first thought I had internal bleeding.
I was kept in overnight.the orthapedic registrar told me I would be better in 6 weeks,I could drive immediately and horse ride in 2 week. After visiting the fracture clinic I was told 3 months until my fractures heal, I can not drive and certainly not horse ride for several months. How could a orthapedic doctor be so wrong?
There is a lack of communication betwee nurses,doctor and patient. Although staff are friendly they are overstretcged and neglect patients. With hindsight my medical treatment was far from satisfactory

entry.title: You cant beat the Freemans and Ward 29, its the best hospital in the NorthEast

link.title: Organisation commented on
You cant beat the Freemans and Ward 29, its the best hospital in the NorthEast
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div:
I frequently stay on ward 29 for a chronic chest illness. I have to stay that the staff are very caring and so kind not just to myself but to everyone on the ward from old to young patients. I am cared for by all the nurses, and every single member of the team give that little bit extra care that I have never found in any other hospital from Sunderland to York, Middlesbrough to Darlington! I would like to mention a particular member of staff on the ward The ward is the most cleanest ive ever been in and its down to her and others that make my stay a very comfortable one where every inch arouns my bed and bathrooms etc is so clean that its like being at home. I do not want to put down other hospitals but I have never expericence such a through domectic who while cleaning takes the time to have a little chat with you and you never hear her complaining, she gets on with ther works and does such a great job. I have picked up MRSA from other hopsitals but with the work they and others puts in I have never picked up this nasty bug from the Freemans and im in this hospital a good few times. I would like to say if it were not for the treatment of being able to come home and administer my own iv anitibitoucs through a line in my arm I would not be able to go on with my work commitments, study and home life. This opportunity of being able to come out of hospital helps so much as I am only 25 years old and if this wasnt availble I would become withdrwn from everyday life and would probably not have a job.
Thank you too everyone on ward 29.

If I had to really nit pick it would be that the corrdiors in soem of the hospital are too warm. The meals, cleanliness, staff, porters, domestics are just brilliant in the Freemans so the only thing I could find to improve is the heat in the corridors!

My Doctor, you cant faul,t he's someone who makes it their job to get to the bottom of your illness, obviously this is what Doctors are suppose to do, but he is different and just doesnt just pass you down the conveyor belt of the NHS of basically passing you onto some other doctor when they dont know whats wrong with you. He actually cares, takes an interest in you and also your work and home life. I have had problems with my health all my life and he and his team are the only ones who are actually trying to 'sort' me out and find out the cause.

entry.title: Grin and bear it!

link.title: Organisation commented on
Orthopaedics
Grin and bear it!
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I can't say I really liked any of it. Once eventually seen by the staff they were caring and efficient.

1.Who decided to put the fracture clinic as far away as possible from the reception area? 2. Are Costa coffee, WHSmith, M&S Simply Food more important than the actual patient? It's easier to pop into M&S Food to get something for dinner than actually get to where you need to go for hospital treatment. 3. How can the fracture clinic be running nearly 2hrs late when your actual appointment is for 11am? 4. I would think it common courtesy to advise that a clinic is running so far behind. Not leave patients lingering, wearily hoping that they will get seen eventually. 5. Would the hospital like patients to turn up as and when they please for appointments, perhaps if they did the hospital might realise how frustrating and annoying it can be.

The new part of this hospital is impressive yet it is merely a facade. Behind it's walls are the usual NHS queues and lack of information. Can someone tell me. Those statues, are they people who complained about the fracture clinic and were plastered up so they could moan no longer. Or are they some form of art work that has cost the taxpayer a tidy fortune?

entry.title: Angry and disapoonted with how my boyfriend was treated "appalling"

link.title: Organisation commented on
Accident and emergency services
Angry and disapoonted with how my boyfriend was treated "appalling"
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: My boyfriend was taken in quickly as it was quiet

The level of care was bad, my boyfriend has ongoing problems and often comes to good hope as he collapses which has been Happening for over two years. We was on a night out which my boyfriend had a drink and was not intoxicated like the hospital said he was. They monitored him and then said they could not keep him in just because be was sleeping. They couldn't wake him up so they got security who basically dragged him out which left severe bruising and my boyfriend could not walk and they then dumped him on the floor. I'm Disgusted in the way they treated him we created an uproar in a&e and the security guard refused to give us his name also the reception staff and nurses refused to give us a complaint form or information. I couldnt believe it my Boyfriend is also a community first responder and he was treated like this, no one should be treated like this. Absolutely discussed in the staff that were working that night.

entry.title: An exceptionally good hospital

link.title: Organisation commented on
An exceptionally good hospital
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: All departments - Womens hospital, Oncology, surgery, Ward 7A, stroke unit, A&E all worked together seamlessly. The level of co-operation, compassion and care was remarkable. The staff from cleaners upwards were cheerful and clearly enjoy their work. The management is doing someting right!

The surgeon who carried out the ileostomy was not very efficient. The central incision was badly stitched and went septic. This was not picked up on the ward before discharge. It was left to the GP, who noticed a very unpleasant smell as soon as she came into the sickroom. District nurses (3 visits a week for several weeks) and a return visit to the surgeon eventually brought it under control. This is an incident which could have easily been avoided, but the ward was understaffed and overworked.
The food was best described as adequate. Could do better.
This report is on behalf of my wife

rating.questionText: Overall rating
Doctors and nurses worked well together…

entry.title: Excellent service from an under used and under publicised facility

link.title: Organisation commented on
Minor injuries unit
Excellent service from an under used and under publicised facility
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: Very fast, efficient, professional treatment. Would highly recommend

Nothing in terms of the service I got. The biggest issue is however the lack of awareness and signage about the minor injuries unit. I did not know it was there and talking to other people in the area this seems quite common. One person who was aware of it only thought it was open 9-5 It is ridiculous for Burton A and E to be inundated with minor injuries when this facility is on the door step

The big issue is the lack of awareness and signage about the minor injuries unit. I did not know it was there and talking to other people in the area this seems quite common. One person who was aware of it only thought it was open 9-5 It is ridiculous for Burton A and E to be inundated with minor injuries when this facility is on the door step As you drive up the road it says no A and E (which I understand) but makes no mention of the minor injuries unit. Even when I went up to the door I wasn't sure whether anything was open. It really needs to be addressed

entry.title: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust replies:

author.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

link.title: Organisation commented on
Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust replies:
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

entry.content: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your experience at East Surrey Hospital. We're sorry to read of your experience as this is not the experience we want for our patients, and in fact the vast majority do report receiving good to excellent care. We aim to ensure the patients are triaged by a nurse within 15 mins of their arrival to ascertain the severity of their condition. Unfortunately there can be some delays in the subsequent medical review, but again we aim to ensure this is undertaken within 1 hour of arrival. We would like to investigate why this didn't happen on your visit and would ask that you contact our Patient Advice and Liaison Service (PALS) which is available to listen to concerns, suggestions or queries and can help sort out problems quickly on your behalf. You can contact PALS by telephone on 01737 231958, email: pals@sash.nhs.uk, or by writing to: PALS, East Surrey Hospital, Canada Avenue, Redhill, Surrey RH1 5RH.

entry.title: Horrible,rude,not caring,midwifes are rubbish

link.title: Organisation commented on
Horrible,rude,not caring,midwifes are rubbish
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: Leaving
staff that actually cared and had good communication skills and understood peoples needs

i would never ever recommend this hospital to anyone i was admitted to ward 30 and was left in my room for 3 days. the midwifes came and said the doctor would be round shortly and the doctors never came when i went out of my room to the desk they were all in the office chatting when 3 buzzers were going off and then they greeted me with rudeness.the care i was given was appalling i was 33 weeks pregnant and told my partner i did not want to have our baby at this hospital and we are now at the royal which is fantastic. when the doctor finally came round i have never been so angry she was very very rude and did not explain anything to me and before i could ask her anything she went out of my room this hospital is a joke it is appalling the way the staff treat you and these are midwifes that are meant to make you feel comfortable and at ease i think this hospital needs urgently looking at as it is appalling

entry.title: It literally made me cry.

link.title: Organisation commented on
It literally made me cry.
Original comment on NHS Choices website
Report this comment as offensive or unsuitable

category.label: Whether this is a comment, reply or deletion

content.div: I was referred to the hospital by my GP as I was poorly at 20 weeks pregnant and needed blood tests. I went to the phlebotomy area of the hospital to have my bloods taken. In the hour that I waited, there were no staff members present at the desk to help patients. Patients were helping other patients by explaining that they needed to take a number from the wall and wait. When my number was finally called I had been waiting for over an hour and as soon as I walked into the bloods area the phlebotomist looked at my belly and abruptly said in a condescending tone that I was an antenatal person so she couldn't take my bloods and I must go to antenatal clinic. She was not apologetic for my waiting for over an hour and clearly wanted to be rid of me. It would have taken her 2 minutes to take the simple blood test but instead I had to ask another member of staff for directions to the antenatal clinic because the phlebotomist had literally turned her back on me. I was already feeling poorly and felt even weaker after having waited for over an hour only to be rudely sent away with no assistance offered. I strongly feel there should have been staff at the front desk in the phlebotomy area to assist patients and failing that, a sign in the area directing pregnant women who need bloods taken to go to the antenatal clinic.

rating.questionText: How satisfied are you with the cleanliness of the area you were treated in?

It is difficult for us to address your specific concerns without knowing further details. Please be assured that if you wish us to investigate further you can contact the Directorate Manger, Miss C Hesketh or the Patient Relations Manager, Mr Paul Anderson on 0191 233 6161.
